text:
The mountain communities () were created in Italy by law on 1971. Each "Comunità montana" is established by the Region to which it belongs and includes the municipalities that are in mountain areas and foothills. Its purpose is to promote mountain areas with specific functions and can have some municipal functions, such as waste collection.
Mountain communities exist in all regions, with the exception of Sicily, Sardinia and Trentino-Alto Adige.
